name: market for fava bean, Swiss integrated production | fava bean, Swiss integrated production | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6713/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'fava bean, Swiss integrated production', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;The product 'fava bean, Swiss integrated production' is a pulse. It is an annual crop.  Swiss integrated production refers to agriculture meeting the ecological requirements (ökologischer Leistungsnachweis, ÖLN) defined by the Swiss regulation on direct payments to agriculture (Direktzahlungsverordnung).

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'fava bean, Swiss integrated production',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'fava bean, Swiss integrated production',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.
